unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals are More Than Just Red Carpets
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals are More Than Just Red Carpets

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wonder what goes on behind the glitz and glamour of film festivals? More than just a chance to spot your favourite stars in designer wear (though let's be honest, that's a definite perk!), film festivals are vibrant hubs for creativity, discovery, and a whole lot of movie magic.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wonder what goes on behind the glitz and glamour of film festivals? More than just a chance to spot your favourite stars in designer wear (though let's be honest, that's a definite perk!), film festivals are vibrant hubs for creativity, discovery, and a whole lot of movie magic.

unnormalised: Think of it like a massive, week-long celebration of cinema. From Cannes to Kolkata, these festivals showcase a diverse range of films, from big-budget blockbusters to indie darlings and thought-provoking documentaries. They’re a launchpad for emerging talent, a platform for filmmakers to share their stories, and a meeting point for industry professionals.

unnormalised: Remember the buzz around “Gully Boy”? Premiering at the Berlin International Film Festival (Berlinale) in 2019 gave it a massive international boost before it even hit Indian cinemas! That's the power of a good festival appearance.
normalised: Remember the buzz around “Gully Boy”? Premiering at the Berlin International Film Festival (Berlinale) in two thousand and nineteen gave it a massive international boost before it even hit Indian cinemas! That's the power of a good festival appearance.

unnormalised: But it’s not just about Bollywood, folks. Film festivals are incredible places to discover films you’d never find at your local multiplex. You might stumble upon a poignant short film from Kerala, a hard-hitting documentary about rural life in Rajasthan, or an experimental art film from FTII, Pune. It's all about expanding your cinematic horizons.

unnormalised: Beyond the screenings, you also get Q&A sessions with directors and actors, workshops on filmmaking techniques, and networking events where you can connect with like-minded film lovers.
normalised: Beyond the screenings, you also get Q and A sessions with directors and actors, workshops on filmmaking techniques, and networking events where you can connect with like-minded film lovers.

unnormalised: Planning a trip to a film festival? The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) held annually in Goa is a great place to start. Get ready for days filled with movie marathons, insightful discussions, and maybe even a chance encounter with a celebrity! Just remember to book your tickets and accommodation well in advance! You might end up spending around Rs. 5000-10000 including travel and accommodation depending on your location. It's typically held in November. The distance from Mumbai is around 600 km. See you there!
